intro: Phacelia ivesiana var. typica, commonly known as the desert phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its blue to purple flowers and hairy foliage. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Phacelia ivesiana var. typica is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
